Description: A measles outbreak in Texas and New Mexico amid the growing popularity of the anti-vaccination movement - almost 100 cases90 cases of infection have been confirmed in Texas, nine in New Mexico. The highest number of cases is in Gaines County, where the vaccination rate is below the state average.The outbreak began in the South Plains region of Texas in late January, the state Department of Health Services said. According to the latest data, among the 90 cases, 77 are children. 16 people are hospitalized.In New Mexico, infections were reported in Lee County, which borders the epicenter of the outbreak in Texas, the local Department of Health said. Nine people fell ill there, including four children.Local services are urgently setting up additional vaccination and testing points to contain the spread of infection. Free vaccinations are available in Seminole (Gaines County, Texas) and Lee County (New Mexico). Additional testing sites have also opened in these areas.Measles is considered one of the most contagious infections, and outbreaks occur when herd immunity levels fall below 95%. In Gaines County, the rate is significantly lower: last year, only 82% of children received the two required doses of the MMR (measles, mumps, rubella) vaccine.Vaccine refusal rates are on the rise in the region. In Texas, the law allows for -conscientious objection- to vaccinate a child, and in Gaines County, 13% of students exercised this right.The situation is complicated by the appointment of Robert Kennedy Jr. as Secretary of Health. Kennedy is known to be skeptical of vaccines and cited controversial studies about their possible side effects. He has already stated that he intends to review the childhood vaccination system.In the United States, measles was officially considered eliminated, but due to a decrease in the level of vaccination, cases of the disease are being recorded more and more often. In 2024, the country reported 285 cases of measles in more than 30 states.

Description: During 2.5 years of war, at least 166 thousand wounded and sick military personnel passed through military hospitals - Radio LibertyAlexey Zhilyaev, the former commander of the wounded evacuation department, told the publication database of the Main Military Medical Directorate Ministry of Defense, which contains records of 166 thousand hospitalized from January 2022 to June 2024, including in annexed Crimea. Journalists calculated that 3,205 Russian military personnel were seriously injured, 37,567 people were moderately injured, and 63,821 people were lightly injured. -In field hospitals, everything is recorded clearly. And in hospital cases, sometimes they underestimate the severity in order to quickly return the wounded to the front, [and to save on] insurance payments,- commented Zhilyaev. Also, -Radio Liberty- clarifies that the total number of those wounded in the war cannot be determined from these data, since it does not record cases when military personnel were returned to the front after treatment for minor injuries.For some military personnel who drank or took drugs, the diagnosis is -acute oral poisoning with an unknown substance,- -poisoning with unknown narcotic substances,- -acute poisoning with an alcohol-containing liquid.- -One day a lieutenant was brought to our hospital. He said he drank four shots of cognac. He developed pulmonary edema. The diagnosis is -poisoning with an unknown substance.- As I understand it, the resistance of the population [in Ukraine] is also manifested through such cases,- Zhilyaev said.Mediazona and BBC Russian Service found out that the number of dead Russian soldiers since February 24, 2022 reached 95,026. Russia said 14 people were killed. Independent experts, Ukrainian authorities and witnesses claim that the strike was carried out by the Russian army. Russia claims that the theater was blown up from the inside by the Azov battalion. Previously, ASTRA conducted its investigation into the bombing of the theater, talking to more than 10 witnesses - some of them survived the airstrike and lost loved ones, some took refuge in the theater and left just a couple of hours before the disaster.

Description: For refusing to buy a UAV with his own money, a soldier was kidnapped, shot with a pneumatic gun and wanted to be -zeroed.- His relatives are still looking for himThe girlfriend of Denis Mashlyakevich, a 35-year-old soldier of the 150th Division of the 68th Tank Regiment, born in 1989, contacted the ASTRA editorial office. In December 2022, a man volunteered to fight in Ukraine. She told ASTRA that Mashlyakevich had no problems at work until he was late for -some assignment- in October 2024. After that, they tried to force him to purchase a UAV (presumably a Mavik quadcopter) worth 200 thousand rubles for the needs of a motorized rifle unit with his own money. The serviceman refused, citing the fact that he was not part of this unit; Denis served with the tank crews. They continued to put pressure on him.It is known that Denis went to the bank together with another military unit, Azamat, who demanded money from him. There, 200 thousand rubles were withdrawn from his account, which is confirmed by a bank statement.Then the serviceman was illegally detained somewhere in the -DPR-, shot in both hands with a pneumatic weapon and his phone was taken away. One bullet got stuck in his right hand, which led to problems with his fingers - pain and limited mobility.During this period, several large debits were made from his accounts: three payments of 305,970 rubles and another in the amount of 81,592 rubles. The recipient of the payment is a certain -Azamat B.-After these events, one of Denis‚Äôs colleagues warned him that they wanted to -nullify- him‚Äîto remove him as an unnecessary witness. Fearing for his life, Mashlyakevich left military unit 91714 in November to officially contact the prosecutor's office. According to the girl, he was not hiding and was at the place of registration, awaiting official proceedings.The prosecutor's office promised that the investigation would begin on February 1, but on January 27, Denis was detained by unknown people in civilian clothes and in civilian cars: they tied him up with force right near the house, although he did not resist. After the arrest, a hematoma formed on Mashlyakevich‚Äôs face. Denis‚Äôs girlfriend claims that those who arrived pointed weapons at them, after which they took Denis to the unit.-They wanted to send him to the contact line the very next day, but on 28 we went to the prosecutor‚Äôs office, they called the unit, and Denis‚Äôs phone was returned. He was in touch. We even came to the unit and were allowed to see each other. Then messages began to arrive that Denis was being -taken away-, that he was -going there-, they wrote that he was on the front line somewhere wearing arm guards. Since then there has been no contact with Denis,- says the girlfriend of the missing serviceman.The relatives demand a fair trial and punishment for the perpetrators, but all requests are answered with replies. In particular, the prosecutor's office told them that they had not found any violations.üå± Subscribe to ASTRA. Stay informed about events that the Kremlin media are prohibited from talking about.

Description: A resident of Cherepovets was denied an abortion in all medical institutions in the city A 38-year-old resident of Cherepovets, Natalya (name changed), was denied an abortion in antenatal clinics in the city, as well as in private clinics in Cherepovets and Vologda. According to the woman, medical institutions in the region actually stopped providing this service without official explanation. -I live in the Cherepovets region, I have three children, my youngest daughter is three years old. I planned to go to work, but found out I was pregnant. I contacted a doctor at my place of residence, but I was told that he was not responsible for performing abortions. In a private clinic they did an ultrasound, set the period at eight weeks and explained that medical termination of pregnancy at this stage is no longer possible,- Natalya told the Rech newspaper. After this, the woman tried to sign up for an operation at the city maternity hospital, but was refused. -Yesterday was the last day we performed abortions. From today we have no right,- they told her over the phone.She received a similar answer in other antenatal clinics in the city. During a personal visit to one of the consultations, Natalia was explained that at the regional level a decision had been made to recommend that all women under 50 years of age continue pregnancy. However, she was not provided with any official documents, and she was not given a written refusal to have an abortion. Later, the woman turned to the official community of the maternity hospital on the social network VKontakte with a request to explain the reasons for the refusal. In response, she was informed that -termination of pregnancy is carried out only for medical reasons in a 24-hour hospital- and that this issue is regulated at the level of the government of the Vologda region. The couple considered the possibility of leaving the child, but came to the conclusion that they would not be able to provide for him morally and financially. -My husband already works three jobs. I spent ten years on maternity leave, and now I wanted to return to my professional activities,- explained Natalya. As a result, the woman had to go to a private clinic in the Yaroslavl region, where they agreed to carry out the operation without restrictions. The cost of the procedure was about nine thousand rubles.

Description: Fires at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant shelter after a Russian drone strike continue, - IAEAFires at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant shelter caused by a Russian drone strike are still not extinguished, reports IAEA. The cause of the fires was -flammable materials in the roof sheathing.-Experts note that the inner lining of the arch was pierced, creating a hole with a diameter of about six meters. Some equipment and electrical cables were also damaged.The structural support beams, however, were likely not seriously damaged. The level of radiation at the site remains stable.Russia attacked the shelter at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant on February 14, 2025. The Kiev Regional Prosecutor's Office initiated criminal proceedings for committing a war crime. In turn, the Kremlin said that such accusations are a -provocation- and -fraud.-
